synopsis.p: Projects a list of terms given in tree-tagger format.

description.p: reads a list of terms from and searches for these terms in sections. The terms must be in tree-tagger format: each line contains a token/POS/lemma and each term is terminated by a period/SENT. The searched string for each term is the concatenation of token surface forms, or lemma if is true, separated with a space character.
The parameters , , and control who reacts when encountering duplicate terms.
The parameters , , and control the matching of entries on the sections.

creates an annotation for each matched term and adds these annotations to the layer named . The created annotations will have the features , and containing the concatenation of the corresponding term tokens surface form, POS tag and lemma respectively.In addition, the created annotations will have the feature keys and values defined in .

param-doc.name: lemmaKeys
param-doc.p: Either to project lemmas instead of the forms.

param-doc.name: active
param-doc.p: This expression is evaluated as a boolean with the corpus as the context element, the module will process the document only if the result is true.

param-doc.name: multipleValueAction
param-doc.p: Either to stop when multiple entries with the same key is seen.

param-doc.name: constantAnnotationFeatures
param-doc.p: Constant features to add to each annotation created by this module

param-doc.name: subject
param-doc.p: Subject on which to project the dictionary.

param-doc.name: posFeatureName
param-doc.p: Name of the feature where to write the term POS tags.

param-doc.name: documentFilter
param-doc.p: Only process document that satisfy this filter.

param-doc.name: errorDuplicateValues
param-doc.p: Either to stop when a duplicate entry is seen.

param-doc.name: sectionFilter
param-doc.p: Process only sections that satisfy this filter.

param-doc.name: lemmaFeatureName
param-doc.p: Name of the feature where to write the term lemma.

param-doc.name: termFeatureName
param-doc.p: Name of the feature where to write the term form.

param-doc.name: targetLayerName
param-doc.p: Name of the layer where to put match annotations.

param-doc.name: userFunctions
param-doc.p: Set user functions available for this module. If this module is a sequence, then all compounds inherit its functions.
